alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 5:54PM EDT until June 15 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR WAYNE COUNTY... At 554 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Canton to 6 miles west of Flat Rock to Carleton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Flat Rock around 610 PM EDT. Romulus around 615 PM EDT. Trenton around 620 PM EDT. Taylor, Grosse Ile and Greenfield Village around 625 PM EDT. Dearborn and Wyandotte around 635 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Inkster, Brownstown Township, Melvindale, Gibraltar, New Boston, Sumpter Township, Garden City, Riverview, Rockwood and Wayne. These storms have a history of producing large hail. People attending Canton Liberty Fest and Riverview Summerfest should seek safe shelter immediately! HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
